item.description:
Indeed, what will you...if you were to lose a twin sibling in a ship-wreck before cross-dressing as a singing eunuch, only to discover that you are in love with a man, who is in love with a woman, who is in love with your disguise?

Whoever said Shakespeare's plots were boring? Complicated and contrived? Maybe.

Yet in the midst of all this frenetic activity you stumble upon his wit...

"I am indeed not
her fool, but her corrupter of words. " --Feste

...and you may want to hang out in the company of the Twelfth Night for a while. Named after the Day of the Epiphany, the play seems ideal--in its timing and spirit--for starting the new year, and for celebrating our 100th meetup. So let's dissect and discuss the characters and themes, but above all let's sift through the language and pick out one or two favorite passages that we might want to read to the group. If possible, let us know what these are in advance, so we don't duplicate. You can find the play here: http://www.opensourceshakespeare.org/views/plays/play_view.php?WorkID=12night&Scope=entire&pleasewait=1&msg=pl

I'm still looking for a good venue to host this, so I'll confirm the details in early January.

group.name: Classic Books: Book Club for Die-hard Readers

item.name: Shakespeare: Twelfth Night, or What You Will
